3.text: Students study biology, chemistry, and physics. They perform experiments in labs and write reports.

4.title: Environment 4
4.text: Climate change affects the whole planet. Scientists warn that rising temperatures cause melting glaciers, extreme weather, and endangered species. People can reduce their carbon footprint by recycling, using public transport, and saving energy at home.

questions.text: What is a major effect of climate change?
People can reduce their carbon ___ by recycling.
Which activity helps save energy at home?

4.title: Daily Life 4
4.text: Peopleâ€™s daily routines can influence their health and productivity. A healthy day usually starts with exercise, a nutritious breakfast, and careful planning of tasks. Busy schedules may lead to stress, so it is important to include breaks and relaxation activities.

questions.text: What is a good way to start the day?
A nutritious ___ is important for health.
People should include ___ activities to relax.

4.title: Technology 4
4.text: Modern technology influences all aspects of life. Smartphones, computers, and the internet make communication easier and allow access to information. However, excessive use can lead to eye strain, poor posture, and less face-to-face interaction.

questions.text: The internet allows easy access to ___ .
Less face-to-face ___ may result from using gadgets too much.
Poor posture may be caused by?

4.title: Travel 4
4.text: Traveling abroad helps people discover new cultures and traditions. Tourists often visit museums, historical sites, and natural landmarks. Learning basic phrases in the local language can improve communication and make trips more enjoyable.

questions.text: Tourists often visit museums and ___ sites.

4.title: Food 4
4.text: Healthy eating is essential for maintaining good health. Fruits, vegetables, whole grains, and proteins provide necessary vitamins and minerals. Fast food and sugary drinks should be consumed occasionally. Cooking at home allows better control of ingredients.

questions.text: Which foods provide vitamins and minerals?
Fast food and sugary drinks should be eaten ___.
Whole grains are a good source of ___.

4.title: Sports 4
4.text: Regular physical activity strengthens the body, improves mood, and prevents illnesses. Different sports focus on endurance, strength, or flexibility. Team sports also teach cooperation, discipline, and strategic thinking.

questions.text: Different sports focus on endurance, strength, or ___.

4.title: History 4
4.text: History helps us understand the past and learn from it. Ancient civilizations like Egypt and Greece influenced art, science, and politics. Museums and historical sites allow people to explore these cultures and their achievements.

questions.text: Ancient civilizations influenced art, science, and ___.

4.title: Health 4
4.text: Mental health is as important as physical health. Stress, poor sleep, and unhealthy diets can negatively affect mood and energy levels. Regular relaxation, hobbies, and socializing improve mental well-being.

questions.text: Mental health is as important as?
Stress and poor ___ affect energy levels.

4.title: Transport 4
4.text: Modern transport includes cars, trains, and airplanes. Efficient transport reduces travel time but may cause pollution. Using public transport or bicycles can reduce traffic and environmental impact.

questions.text: Trains and cars are types of?

4.title: Books 4
4.text: Reading books develops imagination and knowledge. Fiction teaches empathy and creativity, while non-fiction provides facts and skills. Libraries and digital books make reading accessible to everyone.

4.title: Science 4
4.text: Science helps us understand the world. Experiments, observations, and theories explain natural phenomena. Discoveries in physics, chemistry, and biology improve technology, medicine, and daily life.

4.title: Art 4
4.text: Art allows people to express emotions and ideas. Painting, music, theatre, and dance develop creativity. Museums, galleries, and performances let audiences appreciate different styles and cultures.

4.title: Media 4
4.text: Media includes newspapers, television, radio, and the internet. It informs, educates, and entertains people. Critical thinking is important because not all information is accurate or reliable.

questions.text: Newspapers, TV, and radio are types of?

4.title: Weather 4
4.text: Weather changes every day and affects our plans. Rain, snow, wind, and sunshine influence clothing, transportation, and mood. Weather forecasts help people prepare and stay safe.

questions.text: Rain, snow, wind, and ___ are types of weather.
Wind and rain are examples of?

4.title: Animals 4
4.text: Animals live in different habitats like forests, deserts, and oceans. They have unique behaviors and diets. Protecting wildlife and natural habitats is important for biodiversity and ecosystem balance.

4.title: Jobs 4
4.text: Jobs provide income and purpose. Different professions require skills, education, and experience. Teamwork, responsibility, and communication are valuable in any workplace.

questions.text: Responsibility is a key ___ in jobs.

4.title: Education 4
4.text: Education gives knowledge, skills, and critical thinking. Schools, online courses, and books help people learn. Lifelong learning is important for personal growth and adapting to change.

questions.text: Online courses and books help people ___.

4.title: Festivals 4
4.text: Festivals celebrate culture, traditions, and religion. People enjoy music, food, dances, and ceremonies. Participating in festivals strengthens community bonds and creates happy memories.

questions.text: People enjoy music, food, dances, and ___.

4.title: Space 4
4.text: Space is a vast area beyond Earth. Planets, stars, and galaxies exist in the universe. Astronomy studies these objects and phenomena. Space exploration helps understand Earth and develop new technology.

questions.text: Stars and planets are part of?

4.title: Internet 4
4.text: The internet connects people worldwide. It provides information, communication, and entertainment. Safe and responsible use is necessary to avoid misinformation, privacy risks, and addiction.

questions.text: Safe use prevents privacy ___ and addiction.
